title: Monopoly Passes Go
teaser: In 1904, Elizabeth Magie patented a board game called “The Landlord’s Game” in the hope that it would teach people about the evils of land-grabbing. Learn about how her game eventually inspired Charles Darrow’s “Monopoly,” first marketed by Parker Bros. in 1935. The Boardwalk Fizz Gamely invented by Demetri Karessis, bartender at the venerable Dock’s […]
contentencoded:
In 1904, Elizabeth Magie patented a board game called “The Landlord’s Game” in the hope that it would teach people about the evils of land-grabbing. Learn about how her game eventually inspired Charles Darrow’s “Monopoly,” first marketed by Parker Bros. in 1935.


The Boardwalk Fizz


Photo: Elana Lepkowski, stirandstrain.com

Gamely invented by Demetri Karessis, bartender at the venerable Dock’s Oyster House in Atlantic City, NJ.


Ingredients:

1 lemon

1 1/2 oz. Ransom Old Tom Gin(brown gin)

1 egg white

Simple syrup to taste

3 dashes orange bitters


Instructions:

Shake ingredients together, dry, to get a good froth. Then add ice. Shake some more, strain into a glass, and add a splash of champagne for a bit of Park Place class. Finish with a few dashes of bitters.
